meanings.definition: A large amount of food served on a platter.
meanings.sent1: At the party, guests enjoyed platterfuls of delicious snacks.
meanings.sent2: The caterer prepared platterfuls of sandwiches for the event.
meanings.sent3: The picnic table groaned under the weight of platterfuls of treats.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was evident as she offered platterfuls of cookies to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The buffet was overflowing with colorful platterfuls of fruits and cheeses.

meanings.definition: The quantity that a platter can hold.
meanings.sent1: The chef carefully measured out platterfuls of salad ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The waiter carried platterfuls of drinks to the thirsty customers.
meanings.sent3: The baker needed platterfuls of flour to make the large cake.
meanings.sent4: The farmer harvested platterfuls of fresh vegetables from the garden.
meanings.sent5: The artist arranged platterfuls of paint tubes on the table for easy access.
